newsitem.title: KENYA: Nairobi bourse opens week on stable note.
newsitem.headline: Nairobi bourse opens week on stable note.

text.p: The Nairobi Stock Exchange opened on a stable note for the week on Tuesday, with the index dipping slightly to stand at 3038.75 from 3039.89 on Friday, brokers and bourse officials said.
Turnover was posted 5.655 million shillings traded on 183,312 shares from 5.366 million shillings traded on 164,393 shares on Friday.
"Usually the first day of trading for the week is very very dull, but the market opened at almost the same level of turnover as last week's closing," said a broker.
Monday was a bank holiday in Kenya.
Bourse officials said that the turnover was still low and that most share prices remained stable.
Rea Vipingo Plantations traded 22,200 shares at 10.40, Kenya Airways traded 33,125 shares at 9.50 from 9.55 on Friday, Uchumi Supermarket gained 0.50 cents to close at 47 on Tuesday.
"There is a lot of interest in Diamond Trust Bank shares at the 36 shillings level," said a senior broker. "A lot of investors appear to have confidence in the management of the bank," he added.
"In the Industrials and allied, Firestone East Africa appears to attract a lot of interest in investors, the motor vehicle industry seeming quite stable," said the broker.
Foreign investors bought 14,600 shares of Firestone East Africa, and 200 shares of Cooper Motor Corporation (CMC) Holdings at 64.50 on Tuesday.
"Generally, all the shares are a good buy at the moment as many of them are at their lowest price," added another broker.
